item.title: 美团收入增长 20%，推动全球扩张
item.description: 美团的季度收入攀升了 20%，这表明这家中国餐饮外卖行业的领军企业正在成功抵御新的国内竞争，同时向海外扩张。【原文：Meituan’s quarterly revenue climbed 20%, suggesting the Chinese meal delivery leader is successfully fending off new domestic competition while expanding abroad.】

item.title: 减值减少，中国博康利润增长 0.9
item.description: 中国最大的国有银行之一交通银行表示，由于信贷减值减少，抵消了利润率的收缩，去年利润增长了 0.9%。【原文：Bank of Communications, one of China’s largest state-owned banks, said profit rose 0.9% last year as credit impairment declined, offsetting a margin contraction.】

item.title: 英国 GDP 数据将受到最新统计问题的影响
item.description: 英国国内生产总值和贸易数据将受到国家统计局更多数据质量问题的影响。【原文：Britain’s GDP and trade figures will feel the impact of more problems with data quality at the Office for National Statistics.】

item.title: 莱维镇发现假裸照引发现实噩梦
item.description:
在彭博社新播客的第一集中，一位父亲有了一个令人不安的发现：他女儿无辜的照片被人篡改并发布到了一个色情网站上。【原文：

In the first episode of a new Bloomberg podcast, a father makes a disturbing discovery: innocent images of his daughter have been manipulated and posted to a porn website.

】

item.title: 多年谨慎之后，市场策略师终于提升了欧洲的评级
item.description: 金融业放弃谨慎，追逐欧洲股市的涨势，上调目标并期待上行。【原文：The financial industry is abandoning caution and chasing the rally in European stocks, hiking their targets and looking to the upside.】

item.title: 与查理-麦克利戈特（Charlie McElligott）一起深入探讨尖锐而奇怪的大跌
item.description:
上周市场震荡时发生了什么？【原文：

What happened when markets were roiled last week?

】

item.title: 更多内容野村的麦克利戈特谈奇怪的抛售（播客）
item.description: 上周，美国市场大幅抛售。仅周一一天，S&P 500 指数就下跌了 3.6%，进入了技术性修正区域。动量交易受到的打击尤为严重，多年来一直是赢家的股票突然变成了输家，而一直是输家的股票却突然表现出色。不过，最奇怪的是，随着抛售，波动率并没有真正飙升。VIX指数（有时被称为华尔街的 "恐惧指数"）上升了，但甚至没有达到以下水平【原文：Last week, the US market sold off sharply. The S&P 500 fell as much as 3.6% on Monday alone, entering technical correction territory. Momentum trades were hit particularly hard and stocks that had been winners for years suddenly became losers, while ones that had been losers suddenly outperformed. Perhaps the strangest thing though, is that volatility didn’t really surge as things sold off. The VIX — sometimes called Wall Street’s “Fear Gauge” — went up, but it didn’t even reach levels that】

item.title: 德意志银行决定不赎回其中一笔 AT1s 债券
item.description: 德意志银行股份公司（Deutsche Bank AG）选择让其一笔额外一级债券未偿还，打破了欧洲银行应在第一时间清偿债务的预期。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG is choosing to leave one of its Additional Tier 1 bonds outstanding, breaking with expectations for European banks retire the debt at the first opportunity.】

item.title: 俄罗斯重要转运站遭袭后欧洲天然气市场大涨
item.description: 俄罗斯库尔斯克地区的一个泵站遭到袭击，导致欧洲天然气价格飙升。【原文：European natural gas prices jumped after an attack on a pumping station in Russia’s Kursk region, which formed part of a link that until recently sent fuel to Europe.】

item.title: 英国借款超支增至 200 亿英镑，里夫斯遭受重创
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）将大幅超额完成本财政年度的借贷预测，这凸显了公共财政在下周发布重要经济声明前的脆弱状况。【原文：UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is set to significantly overshoot her borrowing forecasts for the current fiscal year, highlighting the fragile state of the public finances ahead of a key economic statement next week.】

item.title: 欧洲各行业财报电话会议上的人工智能讨论创纪录
item.description: 欧洲财报电话会议上围绕人工智能的讨论正达到新的高峰，甚至技术相关领域以外的公司也开始采用人工智能来提高效率和竞争力。【原文：The chatter around artificial intelligence on earnings calls in Europe is scaling new peaks as even companies beyond technology-related sectors are embracing it to boost efficiency and competitiveness.】

item.title: 由于 CPI 数据支持银行，Topix 创 7 月以来新高
item.description: 日本 Topix 指数连续第七天上涨，达到 7 月份以来的最高点，原因是消费者价格数据高于预期，银行股上涨，而芯片制造商因美光公司的销售预期而攀升。【原文：Japan’s Topix rose for a seventh day to reach the highest since July as banks advanced after data showed consumer prices came out higher than expected, while chipmakers climbed on Micron’s sales forecast.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英镑逼近 1.29 美元，英国股市将跑赢大盘
英国大臣表示，英国正在 "积极考虑 "与欧盟碳市场的联系
item.description: 根据周四晚些时候发表的一份声明，英国正在讨论将其碳市场与欧盟更大的交易系统联系起来。【原文：The UK is discussing linking its carbon market to the larger trading system in the European Union, according to a statement published late Thursday.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚颁发首批投资银行执照以深化改革
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚向两家本地公司颁发了首批投资银行执照，这是该国为放开受到严格控制的经济所做的最新努力。【原文：Ethiopia granted its first investment banking licenses to two local firms in the nation’s latest effort to liberalize the tightly controlled economy.】

item.title: 土耳其动荡局势下里拉将创 2023 年以来最严重周跌幅
item.description: 在一名重要反对派政治家被拘留令投资者感到震惊之后，土耳其里拉将创下近两年来的最大单周跌幅。【原文：The Turkish lira is on course for the largest weekly drop in nearly two years after the detention of a key opposition politician rattled investors.】

item.title: 习近平回应特朗普关税后，一种关键金属暴涨 500
item.description: 铋是一种利基金属，可用于从涂料到国防等行业，自 2 月初中国政府启动出口限制措施以应对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易攻势以来，铋的涨势十分惊人。【原文：Bismuth — a niche metal used in industries from paints to defense — has rallied spectacularly since early February, when Beijing triggered export curbs in response to US President Donald Trump’s trade offensive.】

item.title: 马来西亚航空公司订购多达 60 架波音飞机改造机队
item.description: 马来西亚航空公司（Malaysia Airlines）已向波音公司订购了多达 60 架飞机，该公司希望对其老化的窄体机队进行大修。【原文：Malaysia Airlines has ordered up to 60 planes from Boeing Co. as the carrier looks to overhaul its aging narrow-body fleet.】

item.title: <strong>追踪特朗普的每一项关税及其经济影响</strong
item.description: 完整体验请访问追踪特朗普的每项关税及其经济影响【原文：For the full experience visit: Tracking Every Trump Tariff and Its Economic Effect】

item.title: 英国脱欧放弃全球交易警察的野心
item.description:
英国不再想成为全球反垄断斗士。改革可能会使更少的交易受到影响。这对银行家有利，对律师不利，对消费者则令人担忧。【原文：

The UK no longer wants to be a global antitrust crusader. Reform could see fewer deals get roasted. It’s good for bankers, middling for lawyers and worrying for consumers.

】

item.title: 不频繁交易的时代已经过去
item.description:
在《Merryn Talks Money》节目中，英国亿万富翁迈克尔-斯宾塞（Michael Spencer）解释了他为何看好果壳资产管理公司的交易策略。【原文：

On Merryn Talks Money, UK billionaire Michael Spencer explains why he’s betting on Nutshell Asset Management’s trading strategy.

】

item.title: 欧洲在最需要的时候却缺少火药和梯恩梯
item.description:
弹药制造商正在努力确保化学品和棉花的供应，为爆炸物和推进剂需求的大幅增长做好准备。【原文：

Ammunition manufacturers are working to secure supplies of chemicals and cotton as they prepare for a massive increase in demand for explosives and propellants.

】

item.title: 马阿拉歌，或可能永远不会发生的大事件
item.description:
达成一项协议非常复杂，而且其他国家也不信任特朗普。请做好准备，迎接肆无忌惮的关税。【原文：

Reaching an accord would be highly complicated, and other countries don’t trust Trump. Brace instead for unbridled tariffs.

】

item.title: 乌克兰在坎坷的和平道路上寻求与投资者重新建立联系
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普与沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）在白宫举行决定性会晤的前几天，乌克兰官员在基辅接见了一个外国投资者代表团，这标志着乌克兰在恢复财政基础的道路上迈出了象征性的一步。【原文：Days before the fateful White House encounter between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskiy, Ukraine took a symbolic step on the path to regaining its financial footing when officials received a delegation of foreign investors in Kyiv.】

item.title: 中国香港股市将出现 2025 年来最大两日跌幅
item.description: 周五，中国股市暴跌，延续了本周的跌势，投资者称股市在大幅反弹后缺乏新的催化剂。【原文：Chinese stocks slumped on Friday, extending this week’s losses, with investors citing a lack of fresh catalysts after a blistering rally.】

item.title: 丰田的新研发部门标志着其更加专注于印度市场
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，丰田汽车公司正在通过其本地部门在印度建立首个研发中心，这表明印度市场的重要性与日俱增。【原文：Toyota Motor Corp. is setting up its first research and development center in India through its local unit, people familiar with the matter said, signaling the market’s growing importance.】

item.title: 俄罗斯将维持利率在纪录高位，处于观望状态
item.description: 俄罗斯央行将在第三次会议上将利率维持在历史最高水平，人们对开始放松货币政策的预期正在形成。【原文：Russia’s central bank is set to hold interest rates at a historic high for a third meeting, with expectations building that a start to monetary easing is in the offing.】

item.title: 马斯克呼吁特斯拉员工在股票下跌 40% 的情况下继续持有股票
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周四在德克萨斯州奥斯汀举行了一次未事先宣布的全体员工大会，试图向特斯拉公司员工保证，尽管 "时局动荡"，但他们应该 "坚持持有 "自己的股票。【原文：Elon Musk sought to reassure Tesla Inc. employees that despite “rocky moments,” they should “hang onto” their stock, in an unannounced all-hands meeting Thursday in Austin, Texas, which the billionaire chief executive streamed live on his social media network X.】

item.title: 中国进口美国商品和汽车在新一轮贸易战中崩溃
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普开始征收关税后，中国对美国棉花、汽车和一些能源产品的进口在今年头两个月大幅下降，而中国政府则采取了报复行动。【原文：China’s imports of US cotton, cars and some energy products all plunged in the first two months of the year after President Donald Trump started imposing tariffs and Beijing retaliated.】

item.title: T.T Rowe 认为德国财政推进为美国 6% 的收益率呼声壮胆
item.description: T.T Rowe Price认为，德国历史性的支出推动支持了该基金经理的逆向观点，即10年期美国国债收益率最终将达到6%。【原文：T. Rowe Price sees Germany’s historic spending push as lending support to the money manager’s contrarian view that 10-year US Treasury yields will eventually reach 6%.】
